timeline.bodyText:
@tristantarrant is this search option cool? here's the public url: https://cse.google.com/cse?cx=017043654585294774899:cdrjpvj5awo
it includes https://infinispan.org/docs/stable/* and /docs/dev/* in the search result. it works fairly well but I don't know if this is the best solution. another thing is that I created this with my personal gmail account, which might not be ideal.
timeline.author: oraNod
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -2,60 +2,58 @@ Written and maintained by the {brandname} community :icons: font -Get answers and find help in the {brandname} {infinispanversion} doc set. +++++ + +
+++++

replies.bodyText:
I am not sure what is wrong with this particular search box, but it doesn't seem to find stuff :)
For example, I tried searching for "auto-config", "InfinispanIndexManager", "Query" and did not get any interesting result.
OTOH, the one from https://cse.google.com/cse?cx=013887093884325579276:mkumderkeqo does bring me all those results
replies.author: gustavonalle

replies.bodyText: "local-heap" is another term it does not find meaningful results. Also, it appears the operator guide is not being indexed by the search
replies.author: gustavonalle

replies.bodyText: we should probably use an infinispan.org account for this
replies.author: tristantarrant

timeline.bodyText: Can you add querying in the front page?
timeline.author: gustavonalle
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -2,60 +2,58 @@ Written and maintained by the {brandname} community :icons: font -Get answers and find help in the {brandname} {infinispanversion} doc set. +++++ + +
+++++ -Embedding {brandname}:: +[discrete] +== Get Started -* link:titles/embedding/embedding.html[Using {brandname} as an Embedded Library] +[unstyled] +* link:titles/getting_started/getting_started.html[Getting Started with {brandname}] -{brandname} Servers:: +[discrete] +== Administrator +[unstyled] * link:titles/server/server.html[{brandname} Server Guide] * link:titles/cli/cli.html[Using the Command Line Interface] -* link:titles/rest/rest.html[{brandname} REST API Guide] - -Operator for Kubernetes and OpenShift:: +* link:titles/upgrading/upgrading.html[Upgrading {brandname}] +* link:titles/security/security.html[Securing {brandname} ] +* link:titles/tuning/tuning.html[Tuning {brandname} Performance] -* link:https://infinispan.org/infinispan-operator/master/operator.html[{brandname} Operator Guide: Development] -* link:https://infinispan.org/infinispan-operator/1.1.x/operator.html[{brandname} Operator Guide: Stable] -Hot Rod Clients:: +[discrete] +== Developer -* link:titles/hotrod_java/hotrod_java.html[Hot Rod Java Client Guide] +[unstyled] +* link:titles/embedding/embedding.html[Embedding {brandname}] +* link:titles/developing/developing.html[Developing for {brandname}] +* link:titles/configuring/configuring.html[Configuring {brandname}] +* link:titles/xsite/xsite.html[Using Cross-Site Replication] +* link:titles/hotrod_java/hotrod_java.html[Hot Rod Java Clients]

replies.bodyText:
@gustavonalle Based on feedback from Tristan, I moved querying from it's own title into the Developer's Guide. We could add a link to the anchor like this:
link:titles/developing/developing.html#indexing_querying[Indexing and Querying]
replies.author: oraNod
